p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end; color: #0000ff;

div.p: The whole context seems as if this is from a minute book? Should that be part of the location line?
MS 12521 Victorian Horticultural Society records, box 3401, p. 63, La Trobe Australian Manuscripts Collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

[October 1860]
editorial addition. MS written into minutes at meeting of 29 October 1860.
To Dr Mueller Director of the Botanic and Zoological Gardens

It having been proposed at the Meeting of the V. G. M. I. Soc.
Victorian Gardeners' Mutual Improvement Society. held on the 29th ult that the members Mr Jno Walters
i.e. Watters. of the Botanic Gardens and Mr Wm Smith of the zoological gardens should act as judges at the Horticultural Exhibition to be held on the 22d and 23d inst. I am directed by the Committee to request that you may be good enough to sanction the absence of Messrs Smith and Walters from their respective duties for the purpose stated

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be, Sir

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Hon Sec.
See also M to T. McMillan, 13 November 1860.
